verse:
अहो भाग्यमहो भाग्यं नन्दगोपव्रजौकसाम् ।
यन्मित्रं परमानन्दं पूर्णं ब्रह्म सनातनम् ॥

vedabase.translation: How greatly fortunate are Nanda Mahārāja, the cowherd men and all the other inhabitants of Vrajabhūmi! There is no limit to their good fortune, because the Absolute Truth, the source of transcendental bliss, the eternal Supreme Brahman, has become their friend.
vedabase.purport: This translation is quoted from Śrīla Prabhupāda’s Caitanya-caritāmṛta, Madhya-līlā, Chapter Six, text 149.

terms.नन्दगोपव्रजौकसाम् (nandagopavraja: ukasām) - among the cowherd residents of Nanda and Gopa villages

terms.aho bhāgyam nanda gopa vraja-okasām: alas! what a fortune for nanda gopa and the inhabitants of vraja
terms.yat mitram parama-ānandam pūrṇam brahma: that kṛṣṇa is their friend, the supreme bliss, full of brahman, eternal

bard.meaning: alas! what a fortune for nanda gopa and the inhabitants of vraja that kṛṣṇa is their friend, the supreme bliss, full of brahman, eternal
